tournament.name: Monday 2nd Qualifier for MagicFest Online Season 2

decks.notes: This deck focuses on controlling the game through countering opponent's spells, removal, and card draw. It aims to stall the opponent's threats with board wipes like Shatter the Sky and creature removal like Glass Casket, while generating card advantage through cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Omen of the Sea. The finishers include Dream Trawler and Agent of Treachery, while using Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion to provide additional value and synergy with the deck's ETB effects. The main goal is to out-value the opponent and win the game through attrition.

The deck focuses on using cycling cards to trigger powerful abilities and create a fast-paced aggressive strategy. Lurrus of the Dream-Den can be used as a companion, allowing the player to cast low-cost cycling cards from their graveyard. By consistently cycling through their deck, the player can build up cards like Flourishing Fox and Drannith Stinger to deal heavy damage. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with quick cycling plays and finish them off with a big Zenith Flare. The deck aims to control the board and maintain pressure through efficient cycling and aggro tactics.

This deck aims to control the game by using the Fires of Invention enchantment to cast spells for free while limiting the opponent's options with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Deafening Clarion. The deck includes powerful creatures like Cavalier of Flame, Sphinx of Foresight, and Kenrith, the Returned King to dominate the battlefield. With a focus on card advantage and tempo manipulation, the deck seeks to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent to secure victory.

The deck revolves around utilizing Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free, enabling strong control of the game. With a focus on board control and card advantage, the deck aims to disrupt opponents while establishing a strong board presence with cards like Cavalier of Flame and Kenrith, the Returned King. The inclusion of Keruga, the Macrosage as a companion allows for additional card draw and advantage, further solidifying the deck's control strategy. By managing resources effectively and making efficient plays, the deck aims to outlast opponents and emerge victorious.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by utilizing cards that allow for mana ramping, card draw, counterspells, and removal. The goal is to establish a strong board presence with cards like Shark Typhoon and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath, while also maintaining control with cards like Mystical Dispute and Negate. Wilderness Reclamation allows for more mana to be available during the opponent's turn, enabling the player to counter threats effectively. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and maintain control of the game until victory is achieved.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats, and ramping into powerful late-game cards. With cards like Wilderness Reclamation and Expansion/Explosion, the deck can generate a lot of mana to cast big spells like Shark Typhoon. Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath provides card advantage and life gain, while the various land cards ensure color consistency. Overall, the deck aims to outlast opponents and overwhelm them with powerful spells in the late game.

This deck focuses on quickly summoning multiple creatures onto the battlefield through Winota's ability, triggering powerful ETB effects like Agent of Treachery and Brazen Borrower. By combining aggressive creature plays with disruption from Teferi, Time Raveler and Shark Typhoon, it aims to overwhelm the opponent and gain control of the board. The mana base is designed to support the multicolor requirements of the deck, allowing for consistent and explosive plays. With a mix of creature threats and control elements, this deck aims to seize victory through a powerful and proactive strategy.

The main idea of this Bant Control deck is to utilize a variety of powerful control spells and creatures to dominate the battlefield and outmaneuver opponents. By using cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Elspeth Conquers Death, along with strong creatures like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Agent of Treachery, the deck aims to control the game and generate advantage over time. The addition of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value and flexibility in gameplay, making the deck a formidable force in the Standard 1 vs 1 format.

This Bant Control deck focuses on utilizing companions like Yorion, Sky Nomad to maximize card advantage and board control. The deck runs a variety of powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Nissa, Who Shakes the World, as well as removal spells like Shatter the Sky and Elspeth Conquers Death to maintain board presence. The deck also includes efficient ramp cards like Growth Spiral and Hydroid Krasis to ensure consistent mana production and card draw. Overall, the key strategy of this deck is to out-value the opponent through card advantage and control elements.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through powerful interaction spells and card advantage engines. It plays a mix of counter spells, board wipes, and removal to control the opponent's threats, while using cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils to disrupt their game plan. The deck's win conditions include powerful late-game threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Shark Typhoon, as well as stealing the opponent's key permanents with Agent of Treachery. Yorion, Sky Nomad provides additional value by blinking permanents for extra card advantage.

The deck focuses on quickly cycling through cards to build up a strong board presence and deal damage to the opponent using creatures with cycling abilities. It includes cards that allow for card draw, damage, and life gain all while utilizing the companion Lurrus of the Dream-Den for added value. With a mix of creatures, enchantments, and instants, this aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive plays and cycling synergies for a fast victory.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing the Fires of Invention enchantment to cast spells for free. The deck includes a variety of powerful planeswalkers like Teferi and Narset, as well as versatile cards like Shark Typhoon and Fae of Wishes to outvalue the opponent. It also includes board wipes like Extinction Event and Cry of the Carnarium to handle opposing threats. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value by flickering permanents for extra card advantage and board presence.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly using cards like Growth Spiral and Arboreal Grazer, while controlling the board with spells like Shatter the Sky and Elspeth Conquers Death. The Fires of Invention enchantment allows you to cast spells for free, enabling you to play multiple threats in a single turn. Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as a companion, providing value by flickering permanents for additional card advantage. The deck aims to outvalue your opponent by generating card advantage and overwhelming them with powerful spells and creatures.

This deck focuses on using Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells without paying their mana costs. The deck includes strong control elements like Teferi, Time Raveler and Deafening Clarion to control the board while also having powerful threats like Cavalier of Flame and Sphinx of Foresight. Kenrith, the Returned King provides versatility and reach, while Keruga, the Macrosage serves as a companion with a large hand size requirement. The deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents through efficient use of its resources and powerful spells.

The main concept of this deck is to use aggressive cycling synergy to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By maximizing the use of cycling cards such as Boon of the Wish-Giver, Frostveil Ambush, and Startling Development, the deck aims to flood the board with creatures like Flourishing Fox and Valiant Rescuer. Additionally, cards like Improbable Alliance and Zenith Flare provide additional value and reach to finish off the opponent efficiently. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion further strengthens the cycling strategy and gives the deck consistency in executing its game plan.

This deck focuses on utilizing small, efficient creatures like Cauldron Familiar, Knight of the Ebon Legion, and Gutterbones to consistently apply pressure on the opponent. By sacrificing creatures with Witch's Oven and Priest of Forgotten Gods, the deck can generate additional value and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck utilizes Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion to further support its aggressive strategy. With efficient removal spells like Heartless Act and a solid mana base, this mono black aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing sacrifice mechanics to generate consistent damage and value. By combining cards like Witch's Oven, Cauldron Familiar, and Mayhem Devil, the deck can create a loop of sacrificing creatures to ping the opponent and control the board. Additionally, the deck includes strong aggro creatures like Knight of the Ebon Legion and Gutterbones to apply pressure early in the game. The inclusion of Obosh, the Preypiercer as a companion enhances the deck's ability to deal damage in odd increments, further maximizing its aggressive strategy.

This Rakdos Aggro deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with small creatures and sacrifice effects, leveraging synergy between Cauldron Familiar, Witch's Oven, and Mayhem Devil to drain the opponent's life total. With the addition of Obosh, the Preypiercer as a companion, the deck further boosts its damage potential. Using Claim the Firstborn to steal the opponent's creatures and Heraldic Banner to pump its own, this deck aims to close out the game as quickly as possible through relentless aggression and strategic sacrificing.

The main strategy of this Sultai Control deck is to utilize powerful control spells and removal to disrupt the opponent's game plan while ramping up mana with cards like Growth Spiral and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The deck also includes threats like Cavalier of Thorns and Hydroid Krasis to pressure the opponent and close out the game. With a mix of card draw, removal, and powerful threats, this deck aims to outvalue the opponent and control the game until it can overpower them with its powerful spells and creatures.
